newsitem.title: SOUTH AFRICA: Amcoal, Minorco complete Colombian deal.
newsitem.headline: Amcoal, Minorco complete Colombian deal.

text.p: Anglo American Coal Corp Ltd said on Friday that it and sister company Minorco SA had bought unlisted commodity group Glencore International AG's 50 percent interest in Central Cerrejon (CDC) mine in Colombia.
In terms of the deal Amcoal and Minorco had formed a new company -- Anmin Coal Investments Ltd -- to own 50 percent in CDC and through which their international coal investments would be made.
Anmin would be 50 percent held by Amcoal and Minorco.

The companies said that talks between Anmin, Glencore and Rio Tinto Plc on the merger of CDC with the neighbouring Oreganal coal property -- announced on June 27-- were progressing satisfactorily and within the originally proposed timetable.

They added that the outcome of the tenders to acquire the rights over the Cerrejon South property and the El Descanso property, as part of the Colombian government's privatisation process, was expected within the next few weeks.
